main event: Two objects, red, orange, white and blue, appeared at approximately 5,000 feet and were heading south at a very slow rate of speed.
interesting points: The objects were visible for about 10 minutes.
The sky was completely overcast at the time of the sighting with scattered snow showers.
The overcast was at 5,000 feet, so the objects were below that altitude.
The winds were from the NNW, which could substantiate the possibility that the objects were balloons.
The report concludes that the sighting was possibly generated by balloons.
sighted object: two colored objects in the sky
